creator: lists2@hushmail.com
text:
Perhaps some minor tweaks to the MakeEtags script might be in order:

1) Exuberant ctags does not appear to be located at:

     http://fly.hiwaay.net/~darren/ctags/

   any longer as suggested in the current version of the script.  It 
   appears to have moved to:

     http://ctags.sourceforge.net/

2) For using the MakeEtags w/ Emacs, I added the "-e" option to
   the invocation -- as w/o it, find-tag in Emacs didn't work for me.
   My local copy of MakeEtags now has the following line at the end:

     find . -name '*.[ch]' -print | $etags -e -I "$ignore" -L -

   Seems to work for me.

Cheers

I seem to miss something. What are you talking about and where is the relation
to the httpd build? (And what's the bug?)

Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de
lists2@hushmail.com
text:
There's a script named MakeEtags in the Apache source tree --
I think it's in srclib/apr/build -- that helps to create a tags
file for use w/ editors when navigating source code.  The script
didn't work for me as is -- so I wade a modification suggestion.

Perhaps you can suggest a better choice for the "Component" section
of the bug report.  I didn't really feel as if any of the existing
choices made any sense (-;
Changed component to APR, see apr/build/MakeEtags

text:
As this doesn't affect the APR library generation at all, I'm reclassing this
  as an enhancement, and hopefully someone who uses the etags will have the
  energy to review and commit this change.  FYI if you are eager to have this
  applied, a patch attachment is a much faster way of grabbing a dev's attention.
